values:
Know this:

my most glamorous moments

were spent in the backyard garden with you

chewing on raw chives.

Remember when I wiped your tears

that time you couldn't spark a fire

made of broken sticks and matches

but I told you I could still survive

even if we couldn't scorch the last photograph

I held of him in between my palms?

So:

why do you sit in silence now

with your head so heavy in your arms?

Are there dreamcatchers in your throat

that hold on tightly to every word?

Is the reason you don't want a funeral

because you are afraid of who wouldn't show

to view the ashes of your bones?

Know this:

you saved me, one piece at a time,

relieving every crime

that we suffered together.

So:

I'll trap you a glass jar of fireflies

if you're ever afraid of the dark.

And if you're waiting for the shine of a lighthouse

to rescue the idea that safety can exist,

this is it.

I will promise you,

my heart doesn't beat so fast anymore.

but I heard that yours is still jumping

each time you hear the creak of a bedroom door.

Know this:

You are never alone

with the things you have done.

This carousel is a rough ride.

And I know there are days when it seems the tide

will never change.

But I can show you the moon that will bring the water back in.

She'll make you shine brighter than you've ever been.

She has secrets too.

She wraps them in shades of blue,

those skies that come out when the sun is shining.

So:

I will be your safe place.

Know this:

you are the last secret I will tell.



July 2012

Twelve years ago

he found me, cold, like

unset cement, waiting to harden

to become a stepping stone 

in someone else's garden.

And, as if he were constructed

out of glass mosaic tiles,

he filled in the gaps with pieces of love

bits of warm summer nights 

memories of cold winter fights.

Twelve years ago,

he said (softly)

"You're so lost, little girl"

so i hid my tangled maps behind my spine

"it's okay -- i didn't really want to go back."

and he walked next to me

in the stranger's territory

pointed out the maps he could construct

out of the constellations in the darkness.

Twelve years ago,

he confessed to me

that he could be cold too.

Frozen water can be a weapon.

He has seen icicles sharper 

than I could ever imagine.

He felt my hunger, the ache

when everything is at stake

and I spent my decade

trying to comprehend

the heart of the lion that came out in the end.

Twelve years ago,

we spent a summer sowing new seeds

in our own garden.

The blooms always came back, year after year,

but when he's gone, 

I clench my fists and close my eyes tightly

imagining his hand still in mine,

a hand that could not hurt me,

a hand that only waters the flowers

and makes me grow. 

- June 2012

I know this, deepfully
that this is just another series of words 
your dark eyes will not ever read
through the sunglasses you need
to feel imaginary.
You fool so few --
but one thing I wish you knew --
I do blame you.
You are the Bible on her shelf
with the pages torn out;
did you know she decopauged 
her favorite verses 
onto trinket boxes she gave to me?
I can explain how you killed her; 
I know you will not listen,
but I will tell you anyway.
It was indirectly, you see --
your hate bore through me.
I poured parts of you into her, through tears
as if she were a tiny seedling
in an endless drought.
We were a line of quivering dominoes --
you pushed me over,
an immense shove from a former lover
and I could not help but tip her.
I did not need to go to the funeral 
to know that you were not there.
I held my own each day for her,
sucking sweet clovers
and plucking weeds over.
She cried storms for me, 
before I heard her footsteps leaving.
I blame you, you fool so few.
I hope that you at least remember her name
It was a simple one -- Jane.
A girl you barely knew. 

June 2012

you painted such beautiful silhouettes you painted white trees against monster gray skies white paint covered your hands, the hands that eventually held mine but I hate everything about you. The shadow of the monster on your face - why did you never paint that for me or with me? I could have done it. We could have painted away those green eyes that trapped mine drowned your pupils in turpentine but instead your pupils bore into mine and never let me be. I feel you on top of me with seventeen hands on a thirteen year old body I see your silhouette every place, every place the movie theater the park the dark bar I'm too young to get into I see your silhouette in the moons and in every fucking Starbucks or fair trade coffee shop floating on top of my lattes, the white foam mocking me; while all I can see is paint, white paint I can only paint the silhouettes now you no longer exist in my light but you are reborn to me in the darkness when I see a white rose I just see the outline of your hand crushing its petals between your thumbs and I can never forgive you, I will forget everything but the silhouettes for eternity. May 2012

collapsing, that is the feeling
a subtle break not a gradual fall
collapsing when making coffee
in a tinted chocolate coffee pot
and realizing you made enough for two
and you are only one person.

crumpled, that is the feeling
lying on a stiff white linen shit 
colder than ice in a bed that holds two
and you are only one person.

terror, that is the feeling
when the man that shared your life
decided he was entitled to something else
your bones and your skin and whatever else
your organs held inside
you were only one person.

ripped, that is your feeling
torn from the skin, from the ash
when you have to
organize the kitchen meticulously to forget him
put the spices in order alphabetically but
those letters, they can spell his name, too.

chaotic, that is the feeling
when they tell you to take a relaxing bubble bath
in the same shower you washed piece of him off of you
you are now only one person.

hateful is the feeling
when you think of a future that may not exist
washing your shoulders and wrists
under burning hot tap water 
and the Dawn dish soap that promises
to cut through grime 
and your wrists don't dissolve.

Terror is the feeling when something
is out of order; all the organs in your body
run out of order
and the feeling is just hollowness
when you can't remember
if you are even still a person.

May 2012

Yesterday, I was in love with you
when we shared that warehouse
full of torn couches and brown carpet
but we had a great fridge
to hold all our pizza boxes and tequila

Yesterday I loved you,
all whispers in quiet beds, but loud stumbles
so they'd know we were awake
when we brushed our teeth
together at the bathroom sink

Yesterday, it left too soon,
heads on stomachs, and plastic margarita glasses
cheers to those days, to the graduates,
to the beauty of the days
we knew would never last

I loved you, yesterday
when we lived among bricks,
we lived among pink scars
and emotional quicksand and
so much love it hurt our hearts

Yesterday I was in love with you,
the girls and boys of that house
so long to them, now the women and men,
And today I thought of you.

to trade in for some decadence with you,
i used to save up all my good deeds
we drank cold cappuccinos
before falling to our knees
today, i tried to think of something to hold
while i smoked a clove against some bricks
couldn't think of anything much i had left
just sticky coffee and the cheap tricks
today i long to be a troubadour
and sing all your troubled songs
on street corners in nevada
but i end up choking, dragged along
i was always playing hide and seek
so afraid of where i'd find you
i would have searched forever
i was so afraid of where i found you
but i loved you then and i miss you now
i imagine you cold, by your grave
i hope you're growing daffodils,
the girl we could not save

we wanted a lovefest 
but when we were packing 
all your stuff up again in yellow-handled
black trash bags and
pale brown boxes with crossed out
magic markers we decided that
looking away is so much safer

so we were safe at the time and 
there were loose hugs 
and to substitute tight braids 
and henna tattoos
and colder frappuccinos
we drank the hot cups of black coffee
and discussed some stupid philosophy
and needled ourselves up
until there were no more scars to cover

and the phone call came on the bad day
a saturday of ice 
no one offered more than cliches after midnight
and i cried into carpeting for four straight days

i braided my hair today and
saw the picture of you, beautiful and wispy
and cold and dark 
and caffeinated
and full of neon hope and thin arms

and i point and say, that's janie
and she could dance beautifully and 
multitask with a cigarette and a phone and a song 
and a glass of warm wine
she could do eyeshadow and lipstick
and she had great shoes
and she threw up everything she ate
she was perfection
and she always learned the hard way
she played the good music and 
wrote the good songs

and years ago she disappeared.

my laugh is quieter now
with aggressive people at every corner
selling passive toys and cards
and boys outside, and boys at bars
when just yesterday we flipped a cup
and laughed it up
as i stacked my stones and you
bumped into them tens of times.

after calling it love for so many years
under stars and in dirty trucks
a young child who cannot know its cost
and a stupid little girl still feeling lost
have i let go, or have you?
are you the one feeling this too?
sit in the red and go for a ride
only when it's rainy wet.

i held this in my palm that year
only too afraid to touch
curled up to it, how silly of me
under blankets, how naive of me
etched into it - strength for real but
you're the one who's making me feel
and i laid there, cold, naked, scared
by a fireplace you would not light.

leave it alone. it's dead
they said.
and you can say it sweetly.

i am NOT grieving for him
as HE can slip to barbados
whenever he really wants to.
when he feels that sting
in the side of his palm.
or a pain in his belly
a scream from his belly.
a scream from somewhere else.

she SAYS to let her GO again.

because you can play with needles, see.
and you can uncap twenty-four beers
in twenty-four hours.
and you can tap your thick thick skull
with yellow fingertips and
nails that need a little trim.
doesn't mean you're thinking.
because i can hear something
and i can feel something
other than the little white card
you slip into my palm when you
think no one's looking.

you poured your damage onto me
and you thought no one was looking.

I was looking.
i SAID to let me GO again.

i apologize
for what it was that scared you.
maybe daddy's belt or
a bad experience on your
disney world adventure.
or that little kid that took
all the money in your wallet.

i apologize
for your lack of knowledge
that FEAR is no excuse.
neither is the fact
that knives are pretty
or that little girls
are small and scared...
like little chirping love birds
that quickly fall for you.

i said to let me go again.
please say the same to me.
to unhurt me
to unblame me
to unfrighten me
to unfault me
to allow me
to love me
to allow me
to let you go again. - June 2007

i threw away the silver beads
you needled so carefully onto thread
because i closed my eyes while you confessed
and never figured out where to head
the conditions i never met
red hair i wished i'd never braided
and nail polished fingers i never
even wanted to hold
well, i threw those away, with your
stupid beads
in a blue trashcan of crimson towels
like a 14-lined sonnet, i responded so carefully
on a crimson couch to your request
you scared me.
you SCARED me.
don't lean so forward i think i
let you in too much.
i think i am beyond this
when there's nothing left to touch on
and i don't know where i want to go
i just know you're leaving. - May 2007

the bricks on the patio
redder than my skin
your hand in mine
warmer than i could even recall
where was this place
next to the train tracks
and the rest of the city
which never seemed to sleep
and concrete stairs
leading down to nowhere
the underground world, dark with stars
of glow sticks and glittered hair
and girls kissing men
and girls kissing women
pale blue and clear and teal stones
grace the bottom of their red heels
watching them dance for too long
makes us dizzy
so we pretend
and we pretend
while you hold my hand that we'll never be anything
or we'll never need anything
besides ourselves, besides our drugs
our wild companions
our hairspray and Beatles posters.

when did i let go?
i know it isn't time -
you climb on stage and stare at me
teal, focused eyes -
and i fold.

- february 2007

a sense of loss, a holiday
in a crowd of angry smoke
outside freezing in a winter fleece
full of things i cannot say
i tried my hardest,
and you went away
and now i've nowhere to go

how did we get to this silent place?
flicking cigarettes and angry faces
instead of car drives and laughter
and feeling whole with diet cokes
and smiles with dimples
and complete sincerity in parking lots
now turning to others instead of each other
how did we get to this silent place?

- october 2006

after every glance - it's over
where did you expect me to turn?
green movie preview screens
in a haze of yellow outdoor light
where did you expect me to turn?
it's been one more day
of me just saying i'm through
and one more cold night
coming back to you
at the end of the day - it's all it is
at the end of the day, one more cigarette
another five minutes of silence
that i worship
where did you expect me to turn?
scribbled notes and heads turned
and cold benches with no words - 
last year left,
in a blur of car rides
and smoke and night air and music
and late talks and parking lots
last year left
ended with a door slam
a wave goodnight
ended without reciprocation
ended - 
crying on a bathroom floor
reaching far
grasping air
gasping 
anything - too far away
tempted to dismiss you
just to let it go

- september 2006

next time around maybe i'll say no
until then you're just a child
in a small red and black striped shirt
and an ice blue baseball cap
riding on a cold leathered train's backseat
never knowing where you're going
heart stamps on the back of your hand
maybe telling of
where you've been and who've you seen
and maybe every boy you've loved
or the number of secrets you kept from me  
the days you have left
once they're finally numbered
death is a game and life is a fight
but keep your eyes on me
i stood my ground and you took your flight
and now i'll never know

i do it because of you
i do it because of you

because i know i can't 
have your eyes or ignore your arrogance
there's no one left to hold my hair
when there's no one left to hold your hand
after a caffeine headache and too much aspirin
and too many tears to hold in
and i'll say i'll never be there
after the hundredth lie 
and the hundredth manipulation

but babe, i'm right around the corner
when you need me

next time around maybe i'll say no
but i'm lacking 
the ability to spin around
and walk away

i am stuck in a sea and i'm wandering
and you're so far away right now when
you always said you'd never leave, well
i did it all for you, you said
and i held onto everything
maybe someday
maybe someday
i don't know why you mean that much and
i don't know why i'm struggling
but i've fallen somehow in this mud 
and my boots can't let up
and i'm missing you to death
and i'm too close to dialing 
a seven-digit number well
keep saying it's just a phase
you're just like any other boy
wandering and stupid and lost
and i'm just like any other girl
complicated and no consideration of cost
listening to pink floyd and thinking
i'm a teen for nothing
wondering about comfortably numb
when i've fallen and i'm still mumbling
you could be the one, i think
to listen when i talk
to hold my hand and hold my hair
a friendly kiss goodnight
if i'm ever able to get there.

i withheld everything
you'd be too hurt to hear
too angry
too hateful
too dark on this cold front porch
a swing and a pillow
and seven hours
a hundred cigarettes or more
and a desire for coffee
at six on a sunday morning
in awe
in shock
that the girl yelling at this dog
would never understand
and i love you,
but i love him
that walking disaster time bomb
that i can't help but care for
fifteen more dollar bills
for four more packs of cigarettes
just to watch the smoke
waiting for the fireworks
we know we'll never see

- june 2006

new york is just
a little too much like anywhere tonight
in march
in fog
in weariness
and i'm so damn tired
of every flashing light
every honk
every insult
everything i wished to be
and every night i've been crying
in this strange town
in the bottom of a porcelain shower
'cause i'm still thinking of you
this far away
in this strange city
'cause it's still march
in this strange city
and i can't help but hate you
and i can't help but miss him
i want a cigarette
and i want life and light
and i want relief
instead of these stupid glass elevators
gracing every hall
instead of company i detest
and cold water on my shoulders
hoping for april to come early this year
instead of broadway shows
and prada bags
and cheesecake and blisters
burnt hot dog spring air and
carousel rides
mud and sore throats
and missing you to death.

- march 2006

we held hands that night i think the night
she crashed
the night you stood on my patio
pleading, your green eyes bleeding
my shock too much to absorb too rough
to cry
my hand just couldn't find yours
my head just wouldn't find my feet
your knuckles cracked - the sound i hate
the hands i love
the way you turned the key
the way you turned around
only on your way out
all the time you cried into my hair
all while knowing
all while keeping everything she said
so secretive -
i need a chance.
i need a drink
i need forgiveness
you need me.
nothing i said i meant
nothing to take seriously
never taken seriously your yellow shirt sleeve
took me too far away
i need forgiveness - or to forgive
and you need a chance
i need one more red light

<font size=1>
i wanted to hear
but the firecrackers in my ear
allow me to void you, null you
i'll never know what i've wanted
but now what i've got
well, what i meant
no longer means a thing
but i meant every sound
and every thank you and every tear
it just didn't seem real until now
and now i've got a future
screaming tacky vegas night lights
straight into my face
leaving everything i claimed not to love
should never be this hard
but nothing will take its place
i wasn't thinking, 
i didn't think at the time
but everything i claimed as mine - 
late nights, pizzas, cold beer
laughs while sirens rang in every direction
i've missed it now
the five years that flew by
the fact i can't move
every time a clock ticks softly in my ear
the purple haze can't leave me now
glitter black sparkle nails
can't save my soul
and your spark, excitement
will not leave my memory
and i surrender what i knew
to every aspect of you
and every grass stain
that mattered

<font size=1>i'm sure i'll cry sometime
for the boy with the beautiful eyes
with AIDS
with five brothers
with fourteen years of life to his name
maybe it'll be under the oak tree
while i'm thinking of those too-short nails
bitten skin and frosted hands

if it could've been different
if i could've been there

i'll never know what you thought
or what you meant
when you laughed under the oak tree
slowly dying

black flowered headphones
staring at the veins in your thin arms
hallucinating everything
hallucinating me

i want to reach to your weakness
i want to hold on
i wish you'd take the white rose

i wish you hadn't let me go

- July 2005

i followed you inside but all that reached my ear was a cold silence - then a recorded message, so blunt so stationary so far from how i felt all i felt was the cold water on my fingertips burning like acetone in your bathroom sink you called them lagrimas in an awful accent and i cringed my necessary break from you - you laid nonchalantly on a couch you'd never let me sleep on woke up the next morning with so many bruises tears from you you were convinced it was the devil that had corrupted you and i stepped outside for half a moment. my lips cracked, your fingers bled and i couldn't hold still you couldn't hold it in you screamed and i watched imagining you pale cold dead as winter until i learned to let it go. - october 4 2004

<font size=1>
took a leap to the other side
on a tuesday i wasn't looking for
mixed you a drink and handed you
the ripest peach from the bowl
wished you'd jump with me but all i could do
was touch your sunburned skin and your 
over-bleached hair while you slept
silently on my pillows the same pillows
i breathe your scent from 
every night you're not around
and drink another glass of orange-juiced vodka
another slice of cold pizza
pace around for an hour and an extra five minutes
crush tea leaves in my palms
burn sweet strawberry incense and watch
your eyes flicker below your lids
push "glow" on the alarm clock to see how many hours
i can watch you sleep still
still
light four more candles and kiss your cheek
curled my hair and smiled in a dark mirror
of reflections of you
your goofiness
your loveliness
well...
i'm always too hopeful 
my head is always too full
and foolish but
i think i found a hand to hold.

august 10 2004

how many times do we have to circle around and through again your almost i'm-sorrys my almost i-love-yous only repealed because i really do another sheer blue vase broken another few flowers dead another sigh - so collective so heavy because they know we shouldn't see each other at least not like this and how funny it was to think you could change to think i could give you a rose you wouldn't crush red petals between your thumbs to think you wouldn't add another stitch to my lips if you ever got the chance to think you'd give a damn the next time i doubted you she got to you first cut you down after a fast back-hand slap and a yellow-purple clean-cut bruise after fifty i've suffered through how much do you feel now? your fake police siren music-maker your fake laughing at a water-drop covered violet your fake grin your fake bitterness my undying desire just to figure out what fucked you up but maybe it was nothing but maybe it was me august 7 2004 11:42 p.m. - Art

there are certain things you say that
i'll never take further than 
your pink lying lips
your death green envy eyes
you always shine on me and
if i knocked on your door tonight
you would lock your door tonight
and i'd wait so patiently until morning
on your front porch
because that's what you wanted
crushing my toes on the pebbles on the pavement 
because i know that's what you wanted
every word you've said to me -
well i've analyzed you to the core
if that's what you want and i discovered
it's only what you wanted
to hear through those ears
to hear instead of constant shouting
backed into a dark wall with a cold-hearted tv
and a brown-haired infomercial announcer
spitting fumes
spitting lies
spitting everything you'd never wanted to say
but had to anyway
because it wasn't enough to release yourself
and it wasn't enough to release me
from your arms
but you could just turn around
so easily turn around from me
let your tears fall - so easily away from me
for the first time
lack of answers but i KNEW
because i know you.

so you don't need to slip past
slick plastic and your metal can
of intoxicating hair spray fumes
and you don't need to drown 
in plastic dixie cups of vodka
or call me and ask me to tell you
that i love you

because you should already know.


June 30, 1:07 a.m.

i could always drown between words between words like love and light. when no one followed me when no one wanted to go the same way nobody wanted to change a feeling of hopelessness. so i was left on cold train tracks singing about love while another tiny house of straw burned to dust and ash. another needle punctured a water bed of the blue people who never slept anyway and i muttered. so tied down about love i'd never experience and liquid lemon sugar i'd never be able to taste and dialed numbers that never got me farther than a hello. a glass wall rose and my voice got caught and the yellow flowers bloomed on your side and the red ones you desired because they bled so strongly thrived on mine - a communication gap only explicable through our commonalities our fear of knowledge about the only things too personal to share but we could anyway. on a night of train tracks and horns and too much beauty it made me sick you couldn't hold my hair back and i couldn't explain my feelings that maybe i could only love you 'cause you were the first one i saw. how much i gotta move. take a train pick a rose and put it in my hair. drive with me and ask for a ticket [or two] and we will fly and guitars can play when you float higher but the glass never ends it browns and fades you're too gone to let it shatter and you'll never reach me you'll never be there that night and if you ask me... i'll never take you home. - june 4 2004

everything you said so freely flows through the epitome of my being - the center of every stupid poem and every insult i could ever think to say so long after you've gone - 'cause you never stayed around to see it work 'cause you were too certain of yourself 'cause my lack of courage changed my mind on an summer's tuesday when i got so close to swimming when you weren't there that day when i got so close to loving someone when you weren't there that day and there's so little i've known so little i've grown since then and too many times i've thought of you watching kids in an idle classroom and clouds in an idle sky and i fell alone, like you said i always would it just wasn't as hard as you wanted it to be just so much harder than i thought it would be and how can i help you stand when you're all you'll ever be how i've learned - when neither of us will change and we won't get anything back in this life when there's no afterlife to speak of how can i help you stand when you're all you'll ever be? april 22 2004 - sean

it's raining can't hide my arms - a cellular phone gripped by freezing cold hands. 'i hope you're indoors...' so sincere - how sincere can you be? how valid of a question can you ask? ...so i lie. numbers you say i should not feel so ashamed to be a part of your little red notebook helps you accept your fate and every stupid analogy you use helps you overcome something you'd always refuse to talk about it won't bother me - whatever i am to you as long as you just tell me - but never doubt how much i love you it's just a matter of questioning... how honest are you? no, nothing's the end of the world not my life, not a violation not debris and not the endless projects you put me through not a thrown away plate of food not a disappearance or a red tear and not death. not your warm dry hospital beds with white sheets. 2004 - sally

everything i forgot - you're so very temporary so permanent in my memory of daydreams and wondering where i'd ever go with you maybe wishing was better than the reality which followed maybe i'd rather have the dream than a kiss and a wave goodbye maybe if i weld the metal just right and i place you in between love and hate and i connect my heart and mind - such an idea... but so far off from what's real i held you closer than i ever thought i'd be able to how proud you should be and how much shame overpowers you how could i resist? your tears blinded me how much i couldn't cry for you this time even though i thought we'd mesh thoughts of how early our lives ended we'd share memories that could leave us crying in my green pillows for hours my desire not to scared me and my lack of self control frightened me and my happiness overwhelmed me how far my heart could sink surprised me as i finally cut off our connection with bumbling thoughts and excuses and i locked the door you gave me a glance that i ignored and fell asleep quietly 2004 - jason

a filthy green shirt holds an empty black guitar case to form an image he always fit anyway only... curly black hair worries me too much and purple scratches from a thrown ladder thrown to the floor a floor covered in stop baths and clothespins and ruined photographs and a small white string tying a world together - quite his only world except . . . her "i don't want to lose her" just pull the curtains across and no one's gonna see pull the curtain across smash a vase against the wall pull the curtain across no one's gonna be scared just pull the curtains across and no one's gonna see 2004 - craig

i ran twenty miles in a broken blue green glass bottle and wondered about your heart like what if yours is broken? or charred in a fire from a bridge you tried to burn when you promised me you'd never say it again? a regular - a low-key incognito don't want to speak - so cotton is a good excuse for anyone of your stamina anything you want to be and i'm all right - with ten cotton balls swelling in my throat and ten not-so-empty threats burning behind my eyes and an empty laundry basket all i can see out of the corner of my eye or..your eye - yours at the moment? only a possession of yours as my soul floats to the door a soul which should never leave a body or maybe just thoughts of another dream maybe just thoughts that perhaps--- through a twisted way and miles of cotton perhaps an aura of truth could still surround you another rubber bracelet ripped could still affect you another scent of my perfume could still intoxicate your eyes which i will always regret being blue but deserving? you must deserve them somehow and there is something there that perhaps i'll never see or maybe they're just thoughts of another dream a deep breath that you always caused something -- i hate you for something that makes my ankle hurt everytime i look at a scratched-out candid picture of you with that silly coat and your bangs hanging in one eye which will stay forever locked in a thousand safes which i will never be desperate enough to open never again to see your face or the pain you chose to share with me. 2003 - art

nothing but the clearing of throats in a quiet room and leftover photos stuck with sticky tape or perhaps the overwhelming humidity to the walls with the so-called encouraging statements typed on red circles of paper which never stopped anybody from ending something they could never physically start and the brown haired boy has stared out every window and he's still never found what he's looking for talk of trust and confidentiality when freedom is what he needs another door another window another dream and low-life confessions that are barely confessions and a few lies that aren't really lies but an aura of sleepiness and sleepy bodies surrounding what could have been a true being had he been completely alone in the world. 2003 - jason

im still waiting in a cold white-sheet room re-crossing my ankles over and over re-discovering every hint to apply mascara without crying from the glamour magazine shaking in my hands my eyes on the articles glittering with headlines and my thoughts on the memories glittering with your smile and your red hot fingertips from when the matches got too low and your sadness got too high and your arms got too covered. im too fooled to ask. im too confused to clarify. toned arms lie pale and white closed eyes and a head of glass, lungs fill with water a tree sits forever dented and a pool sits forever tarped. alive...? were you ever? 2003 - zaida

laughing. [unacceptable] and shivering shivering by an air conditioning vent lost in a cell-phoned conversation about nothing. wondering if the day happened or if illusions are becoming a cocoon of hope. same clothes same places same feelings [as yesterday] and waking up every morning checking every lost memory of you to see if i've understood your offhand comments and supposed lies which were just pathetic attempts at love - - constantly successful and confusing especially to you. blocking out images because learning that you could hurt meant i could hurt more. they thought we were alike but i never could've been you. 2003 - zaida

it was never you. your laugh succeeded in making me laugh in a cold blue nightgown on an edge of a pier a seagull landed and you didn't even care didn't bother to throw a dry crust just watched 'he looks scared... like you' a rational statement that made me cry in your flannel for an hour but it was never you your laugh succeeded in making me cold in a wide open space - an excitement, a scarf and purple nails and a beat up truck and a seventeen year old boy - a friend never a friend evil, but beautiful - a night of dance of broken ankles of blisters and red shoes and things i'd never worn but it was never you your laugh succeeded in making me shiver in a drenched cabin from a dark rain that never fell never burned out the fire that never stopped burning never stopped burning my skin fuel fuel fuel burned a cry sounded - a sob it felt like a match it felt like a fight it felt like i'd never stop dying and it was evil - a smile a smile that was always you 2003 - sean

a failure of comprehension the monotone of a formerly harmonious voice echoed in the receiver as a thin black needle rose itself, lowered itself nested itself in the grooves of a record while a thin black needle burrowed itself deep inside a thin white arm of equal proportion to a stomach to two legs and to only one ear a cold january day left me with nothing but a cold january dial tone seven hours of persuasion so many dollars in phone bills never changed her mind a begging voice never changed her mind she could swallow a fire but choked on the match thought she could burn burn through a thin white arm did nothing but pull her into a white gown covering the burns that hold so many secrets and a needle ripped a vein broke and she cried and she looks like she looks like she's still beautiful 2003 - zaida

welcome signs blur neon lights a need of rest covers the glare of the sun on wounded skin small brown cork captures every bubble in every bottle sitting on his shelf i'll never destroy green loves a hand and his hands love the green needles through ears destroy every sound it would all be all right but the need of remembrance will haunt every disturbed soul in the bits and pieces of us the floor begins where the ceiling ends everything ends where we can see and not beyond there is nothing higher above what we can touch a lack of hope a lack of faith a lack of health left him wounded. 2003 - jason

'we all have illusions of what she really was like' your words stop me your words shock me someone finally said it and in the shower it sounds so strange water 'we all miss her' your head against the clear plastic the shampoo running off our hair and our cheap jeans and any clothes we found out of kellie's closet and tears and it tears us inside 'can i touch your hair' somehow you have to ask and you are the only one who ever waits for a response 'we all know how to cry' but none of us remember 2003 - jason

swift shoes he walks to the window and presses a dull hand against the frozen glass and lifts it up with a noise that makes the whole world gasp 'look . . . look at the snow look at the way it falls it lands on your eyelashes and blurs what you never saw at all' and the hushed silence is more than i can take and i'm sick of them listening to him and . . . and the confusion rises within everyone's mouths sour with whatever we've been drinking and my brain is too heavy to understand him nobody says a word and i can't take the terrible noise of quiet 'it never snows here' i say with stale breath and a sour undertone that makes the silence become louder inside my ears and the people stare at me like i've crushed his only dream and perhaps i have but i think he should be dreaming about something much more important the hug that follows creates the sigh of relief rise upon the clones he tells me it's okay and stares into my eyes grasps my hands and he's so cold and he whispers 'just look into your soul i've never found what i've been supposedly looking for and i'll never know what it's like and what it's not but at least you can because you're not . . . not . . .' the dimple never shows when he's been drinking because vodka will never be his friend and it is too hard to recall what he says next but i am sure that it is not 'i love you' as others claim to remember there are not enough things there are not many things that i remember just his stale breath and my head slamming against the corner of the glass coffee table shattering of glass like the ice that suddenly appears outside and i look . . . look at the snow i look at the way it falls it lands on my eyelashes and blurs what i never saw at all and he's not here to see it 2003 - art/sean

something so strange about the way he yells and the way he confirms the way he whispers "you'll never admit you liked it" ripping my plaid shirt the only one worth wearing and the only one i can feel comfortable - touching my arms the shame swiftly morphs into amber-red rage and my hair is so tangled that i can't hear his voice in my ears anymore i can just remember how much i wanted to change and now wondering how much it will take to get back again and it's not that long before he starts crying and he slams my wrists against the stucco "why did you why did you have to give up?" i would tell you if i knew because i want a response and i want to show you how much i know and you're right - i'll never admit that i liked it because i didn't because i never will and i'm not afraid to tell you that tonight you're not my king nor my savior and you are not better than i you won't admit you need the power just to stay alive it's not hard to notice when your eyes turn green there is nothing in your words except an undertone that suggests the control and hate surging through endless miles of veins the meaning is lost under my feet but surely it goes to my heart "you'll never admit you liked it" no, i won't because i didn't and i'm not going to lie tonight and the floor touches my face in a sharp rush of your own pain as you whisper bitterly 'merry christmas bitch' 2003 - art

'you can fall alone or stand up alone the choice was always yours' paralyzed words cold brushing near the fireplace ideas just brushing by the fire just feeling i could burn everything feeling a pit so strong a gut splitting a beautiful thing, object, place what do you see certainly never me and this place ... such a beauty i'd take an axe to the table .. to the floor to his wrists to his arms never gave me a reason never gave me a reason and he'll never see i'm cold i can't give you a reason for the things i do and don't do i only remember the feelings the feelings and the grass and the splinters of the wood the floor so frozen from his formerly warm arms his hands got so cold in three weeks i'd take an axe to his heart to his throat i'd nail him to a cold wooden board for eternity never let him die i'll never let him die the control under my painted fingernails bamboo shoots crawl from my skin a need for torture a need to pray a need to pray for nothing absolutely nothing - purity a night of peace of quiet of not having his heart his face his breath on my heart my face my breath every second i can't get deep enough i can't ever get deep enough i can fall alone and i will fall alone 2003 - art/sean

in a house of yellowing bricks in a cult of secrets of true love maybe behind our crazy minds one can say a word and be thrown out our window and one may burn beauty with cigarettes and cold smoke and stay as long as his black lungs desire our human flesh a trail of ashes on our stomachs left us with a craving of control and water torture our dreams left us dreamless once we tried so hard to simply work our way in under our skin this time we just want to get out of the one thing we've controlled the one thing we've trapped ourselves so deeply into the flame leaves scars on our own pale bodies our forked tongues rings of hope none of us have the power for the evil have control we hold the beliefs and truths to be self-evident that others must bring flowers to our own graves we will NEVER hold the flame for we have the necessity but never the power to leave leave from this house of burning bricks 2003 - the AL

toes curl in Humidity's heat like the letter i wrote her atop a wooden desk underneath the ceiling void of every star in every country of every continent it's time it's time and it's time to fly away and of all the things we've shared a life will never be one of them but blood is pretty today and blood will be pretty two days from now and all of our windows are open and they will remain open until we fly two days from now Humidity laughs and it echoes throughout the spring haze of two days from now it's time to fall it's time to fall away 2003 - sean

toes numbing slowly fingers strumming softly 'sweetie what did you take?' cars rumbling with the audience tumbling and i'm just watching from afar 'you promised you'd control it' maybe he did but maybe he maybe he's never been right maybe he's never been right at all maybe he's never kept a promise so tell me what you think of me now and i've never been so cold even at my sister's soccer game even when november was raining like it couldn't wait to freeze our flaming skin even being trapped in a wooden cabin without a heater for what feels like days but maybe . . . it's colder now and the heat is flowing but never out of my own body 'sweetie how do you feel' our wrists are tied behind our backs but not nearly as strong as the invisible tape she pulled across our mouths seven months ago baby how do you feel now baby you've got to start speaking don't you realize you're the only one who will ever unwind yourself you're the only one who'll ever control yourself you're the only one who can untie your wrists from the twine 2002 - celia

cold puddles to your office that drench the jeans you love and the K, who knows what it stands for? it takes three times to get to the right building waiting for hours before you rush out - glasses smudged to the side and finally a beard growing you take me in and . . . you know the toys disturb me with their posters on the walls 'thank you' and 'merry christmas' it's so sad they have to come to you and how old do you think i am? there must be a reason 'i get the feeling you don't want to talk' clenching nails into hands wishing to morph to my younger self i want to i want to i want to i wish i could but i can't so i'll shake my head 'i don't want to . . .' i wish i could tell you why why i can't let them ever know and who's susan the little girl who drew you the picture and wrote the alphabet in twisted arrangements made happy faces on the wall and wrote 'feared' with your markers in the waiting room what is she afraid of? i wish i could - so i could see you again but you can't find me 'i feel like there's something you're not telling me' it would have to be you i like your solemn voice and your liking of the word 'blurry' and my descriptions and the intent way you stare at me like i really have anything to tell you 'hmm's after everything i say and your questions and you not telling a word to anyone and i can't believe that i wish you'd know that i'm lying but now i can't see you for six months if not later. 2002 - brian

deep breaths and closed eyes gripping salty hands with icy gray fingers 'careful, you'll have to let go eventually' our worlds are separate connecting them with glances containing only glares 'we loved you as much as we possibly could' memories of rain flood our ears and the beautiful arms have disappeared 'careful, we have to check your pulse' crossing wrists, grasping harder who begged you to control the little girl? 'there's more to it than you ever assumed' now with beers and pretty girls glances - ever so tough don't you ever get scared? 'does you heart still beat in a shallow chest?' it was once a new world with the glamour and eyeliners in the metal box 'do you still possibly love yourself?' whispering to selves making molehills out of mountains was it always this hard? 'don't judge us, we're still reaching out' longer fingernails and the painted surfaces - yours were the most painful 'please don't let my heart bleed again' i guess we always knew i've felt enough guilt for the both of us 'i just can't stop wishing you were here' and i never knew that it could be so hard to let you go this way 'and if you need us, we'll always be on this dirty street' don't you realize i can't forget any words you've ever said? 2002 - sean

tiles in the bathroom i need to regrout them even if the party's still blasting on the other side i don't mean to be a cinderella and i'm not trying to act like you, i just wish that everything was clean again sometimes i just need relief sometimes i just need to hide. 2002

please remember darling i was never betrayed by blue green eyes so it's okay to grab my hand and i never did let you go just 'cause i've never let anyone here go before and you say you're worried that i'll never fly but you're afraid of a lot of things, darling and i'm just afraid of hitting the concrete like he wants me to hard, like one of you so it's okay to keep crying and it's okay to keep trying just not with me 'cause if you had a sliver of an idea of how much she needs you i truly believe you'd understand soon you'll know who you're so much better off without sometime this spring some late march night when it's warm like july days and there's no way that you can save her - you won't have to leave me because i will smile and finally learn to fly from his window and not be afraid of the concrete scraping my neck and please don't be sad because she's got brown eyes but when she says that she loves you it's the first time she hasn't lied 2002 - jason

the dirt i've seen has too much glitter and too many sparkles sleeping between masses of brown mud it makes it hard to give up that way but he always told me 'nothing is impossible' and up through the ground i still see nothing but murky brown and i'm still sick and tired of whoever's watering it and even if i asked even if i was nice about it he would only plant daffodils just because yellow ones are the only ones that die and even if i asked you if i asked you nicely you would only plant daffodils just because they're my favorite flower and you're so much alike so much alike that way and i'm sorry for the distance that keeps growing with every breath and every note i know it's my fault but i'm so scared and you have my heart so don't hurt me you're just so much alike so much alike that way and you're the only reason the reason that keeps me going you're too much alike too much alike in that way and that's the only reason why i'm able to let go. 2002 - jason/sean
